result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Louis Schuld

records.addlTxt: Atty Huebner
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF14, 22CF12, 22CF13 called together at 4:09 PM 
Defendant Amanda L Buri in court.  Attorney Richard S Burris in court for Amanda L Buri.  
Defendant Timothy Gallitz in court. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court for Timothy Gallitz
Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld in court. 
Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Schuld indicates that he still wishes to have counsel appointed. 

No objection to an adjournment by ADA Beck.

The Court appoints an attorney to Mr. Schuld's case at no cost to the Defendant. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 4:14pm 
NEXT: (1)Appoint Counsel for Mr. Schuld (2)As to ALL Cases, Preliminary Hearing on 10/20/22 at 9:00am
Status of Counsel
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:37 PM 
Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld in court, in custody.  Krysta Parson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

The Court adjourns to allow counsel to be appointed for Mr. Schuld. 

Mr. Schuld indicates that he will be unable to get prison programming if/when revoked on another case, if this case remains pending. 
recess: 2:42pm 
NEXT: Status of Counsel on 9/9/22 at 3:30pm
Status of Counsel
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Order on Motion to Withdraw

[ma] Case called at 9:10am 
Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld in court, in custody with Attorney Francis P Raff.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Raff indicates that he has a conflict on the case and needs to withdraw; has submitted motion and proposed order. 

The Court signs proposed order for withdrawl
recess: 9:13am 
NEXT: Status of Counsel on 7/7/22 at 2:30pm
Proposed Order on Motion to Withdraw
to Withdraw
Francis Raff
Status conference on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ml] Cases 22CF12 and 22CF13 called at 8:41AM
Defendant Timothy J. Gallitz appears from the Stanley Correctional Facility, in custody by audio/video means.
Defendant Andrew Schuld in court, in custody without counsel.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These hearings are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings for both Defendants, however neither Defendant has been appointed counsel.

Upon Court inquiry, Defendant Gallitz advises that he has submitted his application to the PD's Office. Defendant Schuld advises that he has not submitted an application for the PD's Office because he has been in custody in the Jefferson County Jail.

The Court proposes scheduling these matters for Status of Counsel. 

Mr. Gallitz inquires about a Bond reduction. The Court advises that it will take this matter up at the next scheduled hearing.

recess 8:49AM

NEXT: 
In both files:
Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 06/13 at 9:00AM
Scheduling Order
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:35am 
Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld in court.  ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the Counts #8, #9, #10 charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  After Mr. Schuld indicates that he is no longer receiving income, the Court refers Mr. Schuld to apply at the Public Defenders Office.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Co-Defendants Timothy Gallitz or Amanda Buri 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Margaret Gordon
- no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for booking (fingerprints and photographs) 
recess 8:42am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  March 23rd at 11:00am,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on April 5th at 8:30am
Per Judicial Rotation Order - other pending case
